fields.value: Replication Data for: Measuring Constituency Ideology Using Bayesian Universal Kriging

dsDescriptionValue.value:
In this project, we develop measures of ideology for states, congressional districts, and state legislative districts in the United States. We do this using a training dataset from the 2008 Cooperative Congressional Election Study and a forecasting dataset from the 2010 Census.

Readers who only want our output measures of public ideology in 2010 need only download four files: stateWholeKrigingFine.csv for the 50 states, congKrigingFine.csv for congressional districts, stateLowerKrigingFine.csv for lower chamber districts of state legislatures, stateUpperKrigingFine.csv for upper chamber districts of state legislatures.

publicationCitation.value: Gill, Jeff. [date]. “Measuring Constituency Ideology Using Bayesian Universal Kriging.” State Politics & Policy Quarterly Forthcoming. http://spa.sagepub.com/

fields.value: This dataset underwent an independent verification process that replicated the tables and figures in the primary article. For the supplementary materials, verification was performed solely for the successful execution of code. The verification process was carried out by the Odum Institute for Research in Social Science at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

value: Stephen Ansolabehere. CCES, Common Content, 2008. Cambridge, MA: Harvard Dataverse [distributor], UNF:5:7eeaUMPVCcKDNxK6/kd37w== [fileUNF]. https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/YUYIVB

Steven Manson, Jonathan Schroeder, David Van Riper, and Steven Ruggles. IPUMS National Historical Geographic Information System: Version 14.0 [Database]. Minneapolis, MN: IPUMS. 2019. http://doi.org/10.18128/D050.V14.0

Esri, TomTom North America, Inc., and United States Postal Service. USA ZIP Code Areas, 2014. Redlands, CA: ArcGIS [distributor]. https://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=8d2012a2016e484dafaac0451f9aea24
Shor, Boris. 2018. Individual State Legislator Shor-McCarty Ideology Data, May 2018 update. Cambridge, MA: Harvard Dataverse [distributor]. https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/6QWX7Q

Lewis, Jeffrey B., Keith Poole, Howard Rosenthal, Adam Boche, Aaron Rudkin, and Luke Sonnet. 2020. Voteview: Congressional Roll-Call Votes Database. (Instructions, download the file BL75113_12.DTA and subset it to the 112th Congress from: https://legacy.voteview.com/readmeb.htm)
U.S. Census. TIGER shape files for 2014. https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/2014-cartographic-boundary-file-5-digit-zip-code-tabulation-area-for-united-states-1-500000

Grammich, C., Hadaway, K., Houseal, R., Jones, D. E., Krindatch, A., Stanley, R., & Taylor, R. H. (2018, December 11). U.S. Religion Census Religious Congregations and Membership Study, 2010 (County File). http://www.thearda.com/Archive/Files/Descriptions/RCMSCY10.asp DOI: 10.17605/OSF.IO/QUN29
United States Department of Agriculture. Urban-Rural Continuum Codes, 2013 measure. http://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/rural-urban-continuum-codes.aspx#.UfCK11OE4xc
Author's coding of roll call documented at http://www.flsenate.gov/Session/Bill/2011/7161

Warshaw, Chris & Tausanovitch, Chris. 2015. "Replication Data for: Representation in Municipal Government." Cambridge, MA: Harvard Dataverse [distributor], UNF:6:mXEw2QBZgkDHZxXsLke1QQ== [fileUNF]. https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/AXVEXM

Monogan, III, James E. & Gill, Jeff. 2013. "Replication data for: Measuring State and District Ideology with Spatial Realignment." Cambridge, MA: Harvard Dataverse [distributor], UNF:5:K1UBZOzUmwqGnhoGeeGFYw== [fileUNF]. https://doi.org/10.7910/DVN/G1U2V2

files.description: Code to create purely illustrative figures: One of reprojected Alaska and Hawaii, and the other showing a map of an example ZIP code and corresponding ZCTA.
files.label: AKHIreproject.R

dataFile.description: Code to create purely illustrative figures: One of reprojected Alaska and Hawaii, and the other showing a map of an example ZIP code and corresponding ZCTA.

files.description: This code evaluates how robust the forecasts of ideology are in Alaska and Hawaii based on different placements of the states along the West Coast. Predicted kriged points at unique values are compared to the predicted trigged points used in the final measures. Required inputs are train1.csv and forecast1-forecast100.csv from bootstrap.zip.
files.label: AKHIrobust.R

dataFile.description: This code evaluates how robust the forecasts of ideology are in Alaska and Hawaii based on different placements of the states along the West Coast. Predicted kriged points at unique values are compared to the predicted trigged points used in the final measures. Required inputs are train1.csv and forecast1-forecast100.csv from bootstrap.zip.

files.description: Opens 51 detailed shapefiles of 2010 census blocks. Saves the centroid and radius of each block. These 51 files are not included on Dataverse due to their size and scope. The 51 files were all downloaded from http://www2.census.gov/geo/tiger/TIGER2010BLKPOPHU/ on 12 December 2015. ZIP files that need to be extracted to create the shapefiles are all of the form "tabblock2010_XX_pophu.zip" where "XX" is the state's FIPS code.
files.label: blockCentroidRadius.R

dataFile.description: Opens 51 detailed shapefiles of 2010 census blocks. Saves the centroid and radius of each block. These 51 files are not included on Dataverse due to their size and scope. The 51 files were all downloaded from http://www2.census.gov/geo/tiger/TIGER2010BLKPOPHU/ on 12 December 2015. ZIP files that need to be extracted to create the shapefiles are all of the form "tabblock2010_XX_pophu.zip" where "XX" is the state's FIPS code.

files.description: This file creates bootstrap samples for the training and the forecast data that are called in the next step. Outputs are files train1.csv-train100.csv and test1.csv-test100.csv. Required inputs are cces08reformattedFine48.dta and krigedPointsFine.csv.
files.label: bootstrapper.R

dataFile.description: This file creates bootstrap samples for the training and the forecast data that are called in the next step. Outputs are files train1.csv-train100.csv and test1.csv-test100.csv. Required inputs are cces08reformattedFine48.dta and krigedPointsFine.csv.

files.description: This ZIP file contains 100 random bootstrap subsamples from the CCES (train1.csv-train100.csv), and 100 random bootstrap samples drawn from krigedPointsFine.csv, the Census predictive data (test1.csv-test100.csv). It also contains a collection of several output files from the Bootstrapped Random Spatial Sampling (BRSS) algorithm. A new file is created for each iteration, so these files mean little on their own. Files with the prefix "sample" refer to parameter samples from the model, and the prefix "forecast" refers to predictions at new points.
files.label: bootstrap.zip

dataFile.description: This ZIP file contains 100 random bootstrap subsamples from the CCES (train1.csv-train100.csv), and 100 random bootstrap samples drawn from krigedPointsFine.csv, the Census predictive data (test1.csv-test100.csv). It also contains a collection of several output files from the Bootstrapped Random Spatial Sampling (BRSS) algorithm. A new file is created for each iteration, so these files mean little on their own. Files with the prefix "sample" refer to parameter samples from the model, and the prefix "forecast" refers to predictions at new points.

The file also estimates several preliminary models. This program writes three output files: zipCentroidsRadii.csv, cces08reformattedFine.dta, and cces08reformattedFine48.dta.

files.description: R code to implement Bootstrapped Random Spatial Sampling (BRSS) that must be run over a blade server. This code samples from the training data (2008 CCES) and from the forecast data (2010 Census) to estimate our model and forecast ideology throughout the country.
files.label: krigingMeasuresModelingFine.R

dataFile.description: R code to implement Bootstrapped Random Spatial Sampling (BRSS) that must be run over a blade server. This code samples from the training data (2008 CCES) and from the forecast data (2010 Census) to estimate our model and forecast ideology throughout the country.

files.description: This file is best run over a blade server due to its computational intensity. The file estimates preliminary models using least squares and serves to diagnose the best functional form of the spatial trend term and semivariogram function. It also kriges several points throughout the 50 states and DC in proportion to population by census block.
files.label: krigingMeasuresSetupZIPfine.R

dataFile.description: This file is best run over a blade server due to its computational intensity. The file estimates preliminary models using least squares and serves to diagnose the best functional form of the spatial trend term and semivariogram function. It also kriges several points throughout the 50 states and DC in proportion to population by census block.

files.description: The file estimates preliminary models over the CCES training data using least squares and serves to diagnose the best functional form of the spatial trend term and semivariogram function. It also finds the "ideological neighbors" on the west coast of the continental U.S. for Alaska and Hawaii, so that the smoothed sheet for all 50 states will not have to respond to extreme geographic values due to these states' distance from the continental U.S. For the CCES training data, Alaska and Hawaii are never geographically relocated to their ideological neighbors because they are not included in the training models.
files.label: prelimModels.R

dataFile.description: The file estimates preliminary models over the CCES training data using least squares and serves to diagnose the best functional form of the spatial trend term and semivariogram function. It also finds the "ideological neighbors" on the west coast of the continental U.S. for Alaska and Hawaii, so that the smoothed sheet for all 50 states will not have to respond to extreme geographic values due to these states' distance from the continental U.S. For the CCES training data, Alaska and Hawaii are never geographically relocated to their ideological neighbors because they are not included in the training models.

files.description: This code accomplishes two goals. First, it reads all of the "sample" and "forecast" files produced by the BRSS algorithm, as well as cces08reformattedFine.dta. It uses these to generate measures of the mean and variance of state ideology, as captured by kriging. In addition to outputting the forecasts, the code generates tables and figures summarizing the model's results. Second, the code creates correlation coefficients, and scatterplots to assess the face validity of the measures.
files.label: resultProcessingFine.R

dataFile.description: This code accomplishes two goals. First, it reads all of the "sample" and "forecast" files produced by the BRSS algorithm, as well as cces08reformattedFine.dta. It uses these to generate measures of the mean and variance of state ideology, as captured by kriging. In addition to outputting the forecasts, the code generates tables and figures summarizing the model's results. Second, the code creates correlation coefficients, and scatterplots to assess the face validity of the measures.

files.description: R script that takes raw files of 2010 Census, 2010 5-year American Community Survey, 2013 USDA ruralism, and 2010 U.S. Religion Census and combines them into a single output file with block, block group, tract, and county level data all in one place for kriging. One version of the output (block2010uninhabit.csv--saved in census2010.zip) includes all 11 million census blocks. The other (block2010.csv) only includes the 6.2 million inhabited census blocks. This file also creates two versions of eastings an northings for block2010.csv: one that follows the original formula exactly and another that moves Alaska and Hawaii to sit off of the west coast. All of the input files are saved in the file census2010raw.zip and output files are saved in the file census2010clean.zip.
files.label: zipCensusManagement.R

dataFile.description: R script that takes raw files of 2010 Census, 2010 5-year American Community Survey, 2013 USDA ruralism, and 2010 U.S. Religion Census and combines them into a single output file with block, block group, tract, and county level data all in one place for kriging. One version of the output (block2010uninhabit.csv--saved in census2010.zip) includes all 11 million census blocks. The other (block2010.csv) only includes the 6.2 million inhabited census blocks. This file also creates two versions of eastings an northings for block2010.csv: one that follows the original formula exactly and another that moves Alaska and Hawaii to sit off of the west coast. All of the input files are saved in the file census2010raw.zip and output files are saved in the file census2010clean.zip.
